title: Grade 2
subject: Essential Elements for English Language Arts (2024-)

document.title: Iowa Academic Standards Essential Elements for English Languange Arts

43D5674471044D12A7CD319053B0B5A8.description:
Use words acquired through conversations, being
read to, and during shared reading activities.

21FFA447168147A78CAC20D15D848539.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the meaning of
common verbs.

903803C6FDF94ACBA43A65B5D9168F18.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and
their use (e.g., happy: “I am happy.”).

35EF11B71C134F58B7F5D5E43D8D21A1.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word relationships
and use.

DCC8235DE57A47598B6FC84801524CE7.description:
Demonstrate knowledge of new vocabulary drawn
from reading and content areas.

349D1E96F9644D6A9049F75A17535AAB.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes when
communicating.

7EA0DB5DEF104A7D95BCA5D955F361B8.description:
Consult print in the environment to support reading
and spelling.

4ECCCF3BD6F643459A1CA50EBACBA6E8.description:
Identify printed rhyming words with the same
spelling pattern.

E74CF8EECEA940ADA9C1E8D1100A5D9F.description:
With guidance and support, capitalize the first letter
of familiar names.

DE1C6608CE834296BEB74A9B6334091B.description:
Demonstrate emerging understanding of
conventions of standard English.

ACBDF03585D143A3968CB6AC115B69A3.description:
Combine two or more words together in
communication.

A56BAB89D7A54F3DBD3A00FE10835578.description:
Use frequently occurring pronouns to refer to self
and others (e.g., we, they, him, her, them).

BBF6CC165F5D459B9719DACFEEB75F80.description:
Use common nouns (e.g., mom, dad, boy, girl) in
communication.

D2057EAB9AE94A0792BB70F98E15D1F9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of letter and word
use.

FD23C27F54EA4EDE8292C94B2BCA4622.description:
Combine words when communicating to provide
clarification.

C731375520CF4A599C3FC04AC73E2E5D.description:
Select visual, audio, or tactual representations
to depict a personal experience.

073E5759FA4C49449799FA23111B6C86.description:
Identify a photograph or object that reflects a
personal experience and tell one detail about it.

295FA5AF71F243A8A857C7336A1A9E4C.description:
Answer questions about the details provided by
the speaker.

C8587B20E54C40BBB246D17B0E1FB74B.description:
During shared reading activities, ask and
answer questions about details presented orally or through
other media.

59DD143E63EB42D3827A4F3C527A08F7.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as
needed about the topics and texts under
discussion.

DD6FDC5EA33E4964B720B690D37F26E8.description:
Build on others’ talk in conversations by linking
their comments to the remarks of others.

7BFDBFA266D34DE291B40227F7519102.description:
Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with peers with
support from an adult.

6006A7C878234D6081B6351026E8090B.description:
Participate in conversations with adults and
peers.

6FCAD20F6C454378929EE3B353F8F940.description:
Identify information related to personal
experiences and answer simple questions about those
experiences.

EAD137C0DEEA42F2B56F1E312D0C8B59.description:
Participate in shared research and writing
projects.

5839C144A9A345E4912878465667E47D.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

5A58F2656D364A398640F8E99A8C2AB0.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, use technology (including assistive technologies) to
produce and publish writing.

4E8558F771E6449B97A0B0BBAFDBF736.description:
With guidance and support from adults and
peers, add more information to own drawing, dictation, or
writing to strengthen the message.

EE9BE75D66F54B5DA1A70F404513F495.description:
Select an event or personal experience and use
drawing, writing, or dictating to compose a message about
it.

51A2D559E15142EA9C20B06C83C52AA3.description:
Select a topic and use drawing, dictating, or
writing to compose a message with one fact about the
topic.

878876AEE8D341268C3BE944F5AE68BA.description:
Select a book and write, draw, or dictate to state
an opinion about it.

A726FBCB86664CCD94092BE0EB2410AD.description: Read familiar text comprised of known words.

265B55FC38D044F38E7BAE0E0D99333A.description:
Identify letter sound correspondence for single
consonants.

25E44CBA4EE84AE990BEEDD0966DFC44.description: Identify the lower-case letters of the alphabet.

5D51E39E7B274B2987BDA05A6CCAA445.description:
Demonstrate emerging use of letter-sound
knowledge to read words.

A38D14BEE6F3467AB6D4E72E4BFAB536.description: Reading and Writing Standards: Foundational Skills

6DBBF9DB3A2B4AE69BDC0A4C11B53B2F.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of
informational text including history/SS, science, and
technical texts.

08FDE8A38ED14580A483896441926E29.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

660428F9946A4D4D8CD79D222D2758F2.description:
Identify a common element between two texts on
the same topic.

BDC57D57E57D47C78A00DC2E0591F43B.description:
Identify points the author makes in an
informational text.

86D0755C97E84599A49BE5A345AE0917.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information
that go with a text.

E7A9F62D625945B9B6E16E88FF76C421.description: Identify the role of the author and the illustrator.

4810A7CCAAB14EE29555176C94A1F3BD.description:
Identify details in informational text or its graphic
representations.

CAC5CED1125C4D2499C6B8B31FBB795E.description: Identify words related to a topic of a text.

D176F7F47BA5491890FCB34B69C9CF7B.description:
Identify individuals, events, or details in an
informational text.

B43AD2B97E164C9593275A6FDC4DB6E8.description: Identify the topic of the text.

4AF4BB093DA8495CAECFC9E63B35E745.description:
Answer who and what questions to demonstrate
understanding of details in a familiar text.

884199C523914DDCA83A4425166FC8D7.description:
Actively engage in shared reading of stories
and poetry for clearly stated purposes.

5C97F2B0E6594E51BBCC46234D695B19.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

A53B97AE78AB4CECB8C7987DDEC5B136.description:
Identify similarities between two episodes in a
story.

77C3F50984F247D39DD6858C39D023A5.description:
Identify illustrations or objects/tactual
information in print or digital text that depict characters.

3EE67856FE0B4F9EA26EBBDEBA116DA8.description: Identify the speakers in a dialogue.

FEC5663D257F4E22A578452C1F8AFE68.description:
Determine the beginning and ending of a
familiar story with a logical order.

99539B8490F34B87ACF3DD2BD8DC5439.description:
Use rhyming or repetition to identify words that
meaningfully complete a familiar story, poem, or song.

2FB266F273A449768FEB9BD0011A8BDB.description: Identify the actions of the characters in a story.

33096BA7316A49AFBC2DE9D6A6EAAFB8.description:
Using details from the text, recount events from
familiar stories from diverse cultures.

AC58A26DFC7F42E38A0202362C7C3FAB.description:
Answer who and where questions to
demonstrate understanding of details in a familiar text.
